body:
Comment 2: 
Which browser are you using?   The real 'expected behavior' here is
that when you print an error, it shows up in the browser window.
The padding makes that happen reliably.  If we're padding for a
browser that doesn't need it, I'd be happy to change the rule.

If you pad with spaces then people writing servers are left scratching
their heads about where the spaces came from with no good way to
find out.  On the other hand, padding with the string we chose makes
it very easy to do a search to find out where it came from: you had
no trouble tracking down the source of the message.
